meanings.definition: frenetics (noun): a state of frenzied or frantic activity
meanings.sent1: The classroom was filled with frenetics as the students prepared for the exam.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were a blur of frenetics during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The frenetics of the children playing tag in the park brought smiles to the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a whirlwind of frenetics, trying to juggle work and family responsibilities.
meanings.sent5: The frenetics of the busy marketplace made it hard to focus on any one stall.

meanings.definition: frenetics (adjective): characterized by frenzied or frantic behavior
meanings.sent1: The frenetics pace of the emergency room kept the nurses on their toes.
meanings.sent2: The frenetics energy of the puppy was contagious, making everyone in the room smile.
meanings.sent3: His frenetics enthusiasm for the project was both inspiring and exhausting.
meanings.sent4: The frenetics rhythm of the drums echoed through the concert hall, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The frenetics movements of the dancers on stage mesmerized the spectators.
